ca.mcgill.ecse211.captureflag

Class LightLocalization

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.captureflag.LightLocalization

  • public class LightLocalization
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the light localization that can be used at any point to relocalize to the nearest grid intersection

      • LightLocalization

        public LightLocalization(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                         EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                         Odometer odometer,
                         Navigation nav)
        The constructor for LightLocalization class.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - An instance of the EV3LargeRegulatedMotor that controls the left motor.
        rightMotor - An instance of the EV3LargeRegulatedMotor that controls the right motor.
        odometer - An instance of the Odometer class.
        nav - An instance of the Navigation class.

    • Method Detail

      • processData

        protected void processData(int value)
        This method gets input from the LightPoller instance that is running. The method will check if the difference between the passed in value and the previously passed value is less than the threshold for detecting a black line. It then handles what happens if a black line is detected depending on the state of the robot.
        Parameters:
        value - A value that is passed in from the LightPoller class. The value is retrieved by sampling the color sensor.

      • cornerLocalization

        protected void cornerLocalization()
        This method localizes specifically from the starting corner of the board. The following are the steps it takes:
        1. It turns the robot 45 degrees
        2. The robot goes forward until a line is detected
        3. The robot reverses by the length of the robot
        4. The robot rotates 360 degrees to detect four black lines
        5. The distance and angle offset are calculated
        6. Corrects the robots orientation

      • correctOdometer

        private void correctOdometer()
        This method calculates the robot's actual x and y position using the angle values determined earlier.Using trigonometry, the theta by which the odometer is off is calculated. Then, it updates the x, y, and theta values of the odometer in order to fix them. Then, it uses the navigation travelTo method to travel to the inputed destination.

      • adjustRobotStartingPosition

        private void adjustRobotStartingPosition()
        This method adjusts the robot position before it starts rotating. It ensures that the light sensor, mounted on the back of the robot, runs over 4 black lines. It order to so, the robot, facing north after the ultrasonic localization, moves forward until it detects a line, and then move backwards 1.5 times its center distance. This, ensures that the robot is close enough to the horizontal black line facing the robot. Then, the method makes the robot turn 90 degrees and repeat the same procedure, so it can be placed close enough to the vertical line. Now the robot it close enough to the first intersection.
